name: Tricep Pushdown on Cable
how_to_perform:
1. Start by standing facing a cable machine with the cable at chest height.
2. Engage your core and take hold of the tricep pushdown bar with an overhand grip, keeping your hands shoulder-width apart.

3. With your elbows close to your body, extend the cable downwards by straightening your arms, keeping them straight the entire time. This will be the starting position. 
 1. Slowly lower the cable down towards your thighs by bending your elbows, keeping control of the movement and maintaining a slight pause at the bottom.
2. Focus on extending the cable fully with a slight pause at full extension.
3. Repeat for desired repetitions.

4. Make sure to keep your core engaged and control the entire downward and upward motion.
5. Throughout the exercise, squeeze the back of your arms, ensuring that the only muscles involved is the triceps (tricep brachii), maintaining good posture with a slight arch in the lower back.
short_summary: Tricep pushdowns are an isolation upper body exercise that effectively targets the back of the upper arm. It can be performed using a cable machine.
